subject: Investing
title: What Defines an Emerging Market?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: What Defines an Emerging Market?.

hook.text: South Korea has Samsung and the world's fastest internet, yet some indexes still classify it as 'emerging.'

buildup.text: Emerging markets are countries transitioning from lower to higher income, with developing capital markets.

discovery.text: Index providers like MSCI classify countries based on GDP, market accessibility, liquidity, and governance standards.

twist.text: Classification matters: when a country graduates from emerging to developed, billions in index-fund money flows in.

climax.text: Current major emerging markets include China, India, Brazil, Taiwan, and South Koreaâ€”a diverse group.

punchline.text: 'Emerging' doesn't mean small. These economies power nearly half the world's output.

quiz.question: Who classifies countries as emerging or developed markets?
options: Index providers like MSCI based on economic and market criteria
